alert.note: Alert for Coke; Crockett; Fisher; Irion; Nolan; Schleicher; Sterling; Sutton; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 14 at 7:57PM CST until January 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: .Very strong north to northwest winds will develop later tonight and especially by lat morning Saturday. Sustained wind speeds will range from 20 to 35 mph, with gusts as high as 50 mph possible. These winds will combine with relative humidity values between 15 and 25 percent, and fuels that are cured and dry to critically dry to create critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM CST SATURDAY FOR AREAS GENERALLY WEST OF A HAMLIN TO SONORA LINE FOR 20 FOOT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE... RELATIVE HUMIDITIES OF 15 PERCENT OR LESS AND A HIGH FIRE DANGER... The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM to 6 PM CST Saturday. * Wind...North to northwest winds 20 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph possible. * Humidity...15 to 25 percent. * Fuels...Dry to critically dry. * Impacts...ANY FIRES THAT DEVELOP CAN SPREAD RAPIDLY. OUTDOOR BURNING IS DISCOURAGED.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will occur shortly. A combination of strong winds, low humidity and dry fuels will contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Coke; Crockett; Fisher; Irion; Nolan; Schleicher; Sterling; Sutton; Tom Green
